title: Of Predestination and Election
text: Predestination to life is the everlasting purpose of God, whereby ... he hath constantly decreed by his counsel secret to us ... to deliver from curse and damnation those whom he hath chosen in Christ ...
commentary: Article 17, “Of Predestination and Election”, states: Predestination to life is the everlasting purpose of God, whereby . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
